triplets: Large mammal belonging to the family Ursidae, found in various habitats including forests, mountains, and tundra
Wildlife viewing, ecological studies, and in some cultures, symbolic or conservation purposes
Natural animal body composed of fur, muscles, bones, and internal organs
Fur that provides insulation and camouflage
Claws used for digging, climbing, and hunting
Teeth adapted for omnivorous diet, including molars for grinding and canines for tearing
Varies by species; common colors include brown, black, white (polar bear), and shades in between
Ecosystems as apex predators or omnivores, food chains, and wildlife biodiversity
Ranges from 100–700 kg depending on species and age
Approximately 1.2–3 meters when standing on hind legs
Typically 20–30 years in the wild; may live longer in captivity
